data:
Facsimile Images

πυραῖς ἐποίε̄σε Κλισυμ̣ι̣ς Πάβ̣[..]++ ? ++

Apparatus criticus

Text after Arena (IGASM 2) ; Orlandini (1968): Πυραὶς ἐποίε̄σε καὶ Σύπ̣α̣ς παρ̣[έ]β̣[απσε].

English translation

Klisymis son of Pab(ios?) made me for the tomb.

Italian translation

Per la tomba mi fece Klisymis figlio di Pab(ios?).

commentary

Artist's signature on the shoulder of a big stamnos, containing bones. According to Arena's interpretation, which I accept, the inscription would indicate that the vessel was made to serve as an ossuary. The anomalous structure of the sentence would derive from the producer's wish to emphasise the funerary context for which the vessel was conceived. Usually, in fact, this particular form of vessel is used for storing or serving liquids.

bibliography

  • Arena 2002 107 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001373
  • Dubois 1989 174 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000187
  • Guarducci 1967-1978 IV, 432, n. 1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000193
  • Orlandini 1968 154-155, pls. 58.2, 59 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002477
  • Orlandini 1968-1969 329-331, pl. 48.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001463
